title: Fix paths in release script, update crate versions
Separate ci steps
Fixing `.drone.yml`
body:
This took so many tries, but its ready to go. This includes:

- Combining all the cargo tasks into one step. This seems to be the [recommended way](https://docs.drone.io/pipeline/kubernetes/examples/language/rust/) to handle rust pipelines in drone, and it gets around the cache issue. Maybe not ideal, but also not a big deal, since the most important information is what line / where the build failed, which the log still tells us.
- Ran clippy, and added another lint for builds to pass.
- Fixed the drone docker publish plugin by adding explicit `add_host` IP addresses for several crates.io related domains, since DNS resolution breaks in the drone container, probably because they use an old docker build inside.
- Removed the `cargo install workspaces ... cargo exec` steps, changed them to just do `cargo check --workspace --no-default-features`
- Added a notify on failure block at `ntfy.sh/lemmy_drone_ci`, so I get live notifiations for when a build fails, and a link to the build. You can also add this if you have android, or through the ntfy web client.
- Use simple `alpine:3` image for image prep
- 1.67.0 upgrade
- Postgres 15 upgrade.

Note: I tried many times switching from `clux/muslrust`, to `rust:1.67.0-alpine` (which also is a musl image, but maintained by rust), but unfortunately the binary it built kept segfaulting when running on alpine, with no clear indication of what was wrong.

title: Use join_all instead of try_join_all. Fixes #2673
body: Okay this was an easy fix. There was conflicting documentation on whether `join_all` would fail if one of the futures had an error, like `try_join_all` . It seems that after `futures: 0.3`, [join_all won't fail.](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/61481079/how-can-i-join-all-the-futures-in-a-vector-without-cancelling-on-failure-like-jo)

title: Speeding up comment-ltree migration, fixing index creation. Fixes #2664
Update message_id to comply with RFC 2822
body:
The RFC 2822 format standard requires the message ID to be enclosed within angle brackets. If the standard is not followed, SpamAssassin deducts points from the e-mail.

Solves Issue #2667

For now image uploads are failing with `thread 'actix-rt|system:0|arbiter:0' panicked at 'No auth header for picture upload', crates/routes/src/images.rs:97:6`, but that seems like a problem with lemmy-ui (using latest main branch).

title: Allow embedding Lemmy, fix setup error
body:
This moves the main.rs code into lib.rs, so that it can be included by other crates. I am using this in to test lemmyBB in https://github.com/LemmyNet/lemmyBB/pull/70 so that no additional setup like bash scripts are needed. In the future I also plan to provide a production build variant of lemmyBB which embeds Lemmy, which will make installation easier (one less  binary to install).

Additionally i noticed a bug during site setup, if none of the rate limit vars is set, diesel throws an error "There are no changes to save. This query cannot be built".

title: Use enum for registration mode setting
body: As a first step for https://github.com/LemmyNet/lemmy/issues/2601, Im replacing the local_site columns `open_registration` and `require_application` with a single enum column `registration_mode`. The current separate bools can be confusing, and allow representing invalid values like `open_registration == false && require_application == true`.

title: Rework websocket
body:
This is a continuation of #2593. I decided to move all the code for receiving websocket requests into the top-level crate, so that there is a logical control flow without having to pass function pointers around. However I ran into some problems with the websocket actor code, which doesnt support async and requires weird workarounds. So i ripped all that out and replaced it with normal method calls. This is much easier to understand, and probably also more performant due to removing all these indirections. 

Its worth emphasizing that `actix` doesnt support async (evidenced by usage of `ThreadRng`), so it probably limited the performance. The current code also serializes structs to json and then deserializes again, even for basic calls like `GetUsersOnline`. Clearly very inefficient.

I removed some of the tracing code during rewrite, not sure how that should be added back.

Btw this uses `actix-ws` crate from @asonix now :)

title: Check user accepted before sending jwt in password reset (fixes #2591)
Relax honeypot check (fixes #2595)
Refactor crates for parallel build
body:
This change decouples the code in `api`, `api_crud` and `routes` crates from `apub`, so that they can all be compiled in parallel. This saves a lot of time for incremental builds, especially when making changes to database code. In my tests after running `cargo clean -p lemmy_utils`, build time is reduced from 115s to 71s. 

This required some refactoring and moving code around. In particular, some API handlers had to be moved to lemmy_apub, because they require apub types to work. I also had to add a SendActivity trait, so that activities dont have to be sent directly from api handlers, but generically from the top-level crate.

Before:
![Screenshot_20221129_164404](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1044450/204575529-51b83575-5d9c-4ceb-b8b9-6f81cfe9e731.png)

After:
![Screenshot_20221129_164411](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1044450/204575675-1aab8424-b8fe-4db4-a6ec-2614948645a3.png)

title: Add some more clippy lints
Add support for Featured Posts
body:
This is the backend changes for adding Featured Posts (Local and Community) (https://github.com/LemmyNet/lemmy/issues/2067). Summary of changes below:

* General rename of Sticky -> Feature, where appropriate
* Add featured_community and featured_local database fields to Post/PostAggregates
* Update 'FeaturePost' endpoint to differentiate between local/community featuring.
* Update PostQuery to order correctly for featured posts in Local/Community view

Only current uncertainty is around changes in apub, please give guidance on whether I did it properly or not.

Once this PR is approved, I will make the PRs for the frontend changes, and merge all at once.

Thanks!

Child PRS:
 - https://github.com/LemmyNet/lemmy-js-client/pull/88
 - https://github.com/LemmyNet/lemmy-ui/pull/873
 - https://github.com/LemmyNet/lemmy-translations/pull/31

title: Use audience field to federate items in groups (fixes #2464)
body:
Adds the audience field for federation to all objects and activities which belong to a specific community. This is in accordance with [FEP-1b12](https://codeberg.org/fediverse/fep/src/branch/main/feps/fep-1b12.md). Audience field is optional when receiving so this is fully backwards compatible. 

Sadly it doesnt look like this will simplify the code, because we still have to verify that the community which is specified in `audience` field matches other data. Eg when posting a comment, the `audience` community has to match the community of the post.

This adds a few missing or incorrect API fields:

- discussion_languages to `CreateCommunity` and `CommunityResponse`. Necessary because `EditCommunity` needs to return the new languages if those got changed.
- Changes `MyUserInfo.discussionLanguage` from the `Language` to a simple number, `LanguageId` . The full language isn't necessary anywhere but from the SiteResponse.
- Adds taglines to CreateSite for consistency.

title: Update doku dependency for easier formatting of defaults.hjson
When announcing incoming activities, keep extra fields
body: When receiving an activity from another software and announcing it in a community, it should keep any custom fields. This is currently handled via `Unparsed`, but that doesnt work for nested fields (eg attachments), and is easier to forget. It seems better to store the exact json that gets received, and send the same json out wrapped in Announce.

title: Translated README.md to Chinese
Add support for Taglines
body:
Addresses https://github.com/LemmyNet/lemmy/issues/2074

In this PR:

* Add database table: taglines (int id, string content)
* Add CRUD endpoints (Create, Edit, Delete)
* Add API endpoints (GetRandomTagline, ListTaglines)

I have a branch for frontend changes, but would like to get reviews on backend first before going too far. Please give this a review and let me know if I missed anything or broke conventions in any way. Once this is approved, I will make a PR for the frontend; we can merge at the same time after that is approved as well.

Child PRs:

title: Image improvements
body:
Thumbnail param can only be i32, no need to take string. And it doesnt make sense to force jpg format when nothing is given.

I also tried to use resize instead of thumbnail as param as it should give better quality, but that didnt work and also doesnt seem to make any difference in practice.

title: Enable lto, strip symbols via cargo.toml
body:
Thin lto doesnt have any effect on compile time in my tests, and should improve performance. So no reason to leave it disabled. Stripping symbols via cargo.toml might be slightly faster, and means one step less in docker builds.

We could also try full lto, but it doubles build time and i fear that ci might time out then.

title: Add diesel_async, get rid of blocking function
Fix docker dev build
body:
This fixes the `docker_update.sh` script, as well as makes the local builds for lemmy and lemmy-ui (rather than the nightly dev docker images) the default. 

The docker dev build was also broken, because the lemmy.hjson was missing the required database block. Another reminder to never merge other peoples work without testing first.

title: Federate votes as private
body: I looked into it and this change is actually backwards compatible with Lemmy 0.16.6 which was relesed in July. I think it makes sense to include this in 0.17, so that other software doesnt leak the names of users who voted (iirc this happens with hubzilla). Older Lemmy versions would be unable to federate votes then, but other things would work fine.

title: Return empty vec when reading all languages (fixes #2495)
body: Actually this approach looks fine in terms of performance, just reads some unnecessary data but no extra queries are necessary.

title: Only allow authenticated users to fetch remote objects
body: Only logged in users can use resolve object endpoint to fetch remote activitypub objects. In case of an unauthenticated user, only objects which are already stored in the instance database will be returned.

title: Moving settings to Database.
body:
- Moves many settings into the database. Fixes #2285
- Adds a local_site and instance table. Fixes #2365 . Fixes #2368
- Separates SQL update an insert forms, to avoid runtime errors.
- Adds TypedBuilder to all the SQL forms, instead of default.

A few more things:

- All sites, communities, and persons now are linked to an `instance_id`, which should make querying them easier, and opens up some possibilities for apub simplification.
- Adds an `instance` table, with a `domain: String` column. These are not checked or verified, since they could be "blocked" instances, or ones we've never connected to.
- Adds `allowlist` and `blocklist` tables that link to instance_ids . The `CreateSite` and `UpdateSite`, in addition to all the new local settings type columns, also now have `allowed_instances: Option<String>`, that's a comma-delimited list of instances. An empty string clears them.
- Adds migrations so that a `local_site` and `site` row will always exist, with a `site_setup` column used to decide whether its the first person creating the site.

@Nutomic Although most of the apub tests are passing, I'm sure that the way I added the `instance` table is incorrect. You might think of additional uses for it, such as adding a `verified` column. 

*You do not need to look over anything in this PR besides the apub stuff.*

body: Fixes bug where instance admins were able to carry out mod actions in remote communities.

title: Fix rate limit error messages. Fixes #2428
Fix missing local user from post queries.
Allow filtering out of deleted and removed comments when getting person details
body:
For https://github.com/LemmyNet/lemmy/issues/1053

While showing deleted/removed comments for a post might be useful because these comments might have children that are not removed. On the other hand, while is user is viewing the profile of another user, it might be helpful to not show deleted/removed comments to avoid clutter. When a user is viewing their own profile, they may or may not want to see deleted/removed comments depending on whether they want to restore a deleted comment.

In the PR I add basic provision of filtering out deleted and removed comments from the user view as well a parameter in the `CommentQuery::builder` for the same. This filtering is disabled by default so it won't break any frontend behaviour.

title: Pass LocalUser to PostQuery etc, instead of separate params
body: After https://github.com/LemmyNet/lemmy/pull/2269 i decided to check that parameters for PostQuery were passed correctly, and it turns out there were some places where only PersonId was passed, but not LocalUserId. This means that language tagging wouldnt have worked correctly in those places. In order to fix that properly, i decided to remove all the separate params, and simply pass in LocalUser, which holds all the relevant data. Same for other view queries. This also simplifies the code.
